title: 113_s1415
content:
The Act is titled the "Canyon Mountain Land Conveyance Act of 2013" and includes definitions for clarity. The Act defines "Federal land" as approximately 17,826 acres depicted on a specific map and "planning area" as land administered by the Bureau of Land Management in various districts. The term "public domain land" is defined as land managed in accordance with the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976, excluding land managed under the Act of August 28, 1937. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of the Interior, and "Tribe" refers to the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians. SEC. 3. CONVEYANCE.

All US rights to Federal land, including improvements, minerals, oil, and gas, will be held in trust for the Tribe and become part of their reservation. A survey to establish boundaries must be completed within 180 days.

SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. SEC. 4. MAP AND LEGAL DESCRIPTION. The Secretary will file a map and legal description of Federal land with specified committees. The filed map and legal description will have the same force as the Act, with the Secretary allowed to correct errors. The information will be available for public inspection. SEC. 5. ADMINISTRATION. This section clarifies that existing tribal rights to land are unaffected by the Act, prohibits the export of unprocessed logs from Federal land, and restricts gaming activities on land taken into trust. SEC. 6. FOREST MANAGEMENT. Commercial forestry activities on Federal land must comply with all applicable Federal laws. SEC. 7. LAND RECLASSIFICATION. The Secretary of Agriculture and the Secretary must identify Oregon and California Railroad land within 180 days. Public domain land of similar acreage and condition must be identified within 18 months. Maps depicting the identified land must be submitted to Congress within 2 years. After identifying Oregon and California Railroad land, the Secretary will reclassify it as owned by the railroad after public comment. The Act of August 28, 1937 will apply to the reclassified land.
